review: Caesar Salad had no dressing on it. Ok, it's better than too much but seriously, it was bone dry. Had the Spicy Chicken Tinga Quesadilla from the small plate menu and the toppings were a little sparce but for that price point I couldn't expect too much. The Ranchito sauce was awesome though and after I ran out of the caesear dressing that they brought extra for my salad, I polished off the salad with that.  Staff is fast and very attentive with food and drink requests.  Was dead at 11:25, then about half the place filled out by 11:35.

This CPK is located in Park Place, close to Ruth Chris' Steakhouse and 24 Fitness.  Parking was a bit confusing for me because I couldn't tell what was roped off for Ruth Chris' valets..  And the lot is not huge at all. CPK makes great thin crusted pizzas, and that's what I usually get here.  With my bf, I share a pizza and a small plate (what they call their appetizers).  My favorite small plate is the asparagus and arugula salad.  They put just the right amount of sun-dried tomatoes, almonds, and parmesan cheese to make the salad so tasty!  For an additional $2, you can split the toppings on a pizza.  While my bf prefers the bbq chicken, I like the tostada and california club.  Join the CPK club, and you can get a free small plate for signing up for emails! The other day we asked for regular crust, but they gave us the thin crust instead.. It wasn't that big of a deal because I like thin crust anyway, but wish they could be more careful next time with inputting the orders.   I think CPK is trying out a new thing where they serve fresh bread when you are seated.  I never had that before at other locations and it was my first time here, so maybe it was just this particular location ?  I'm not too sure.  They serve the free bread with some herb-seasoned olive oil.  It was good, but feels like a little carb overload, considering all that dough on the pizzas.. Just saying.

California Pizza Kitchen has always been one of those comfort restaurants for my family and I to fall back on whenever trying to decide where to eat.  We seem to choose either here or P.F. Chang's China Bistro. Well as I've said before in my many other California Pizza Kitchen reviews, my daughter loves their Sedona Tortilla Soup and I love their Thai Crunch Salad, so that is what we both ordered.  We shared a little of each other's dishes and we both walked out very satisfied. We dined here yesterday and had very good service.  They were a little busy, so I was happy that we were still able to be seated at a booth.  Our waiter was very friendly and efficient taking our orders for drinks and offering our family their menus.  My daughter always enjoys being able to color her menu.  Not all restaurants consistently offer her something to keep her busy and help pass the time.  Shortly after we received our drinks, he took our orders since we are regulars and didn't need much time to look over their menu.  He offered us bread from the start, which was great since many times in Hawaii I would have to ask for it. Everyone's food arrived pretty quickly and were presented beautifully.  The food was great as always expected.  They can definitely count on us being back the next time we're in the area!

[CATERING REVIEW] Almost 1x / week, my company orders lunch for us here. We always get the same thing, and it's satisfying each time! Thai Crunch Salad = I really like the dressing on this. A light Thai peanut sauce. Love the avocado + edamame in it! Sandwich Platter = Has a variety of California Club, Chicken Caesar, and Italian Deli.  I always eat the Italian Deli since I love italian meats! All come with great foccacia bread. They're cut into half sizes, so people can pick and choose to try more than 1 kind. Four-Cheese Ravioli + Mushroom = Super rich pasta dish, but really savory and the mushrooms are thickly cut and plentiful. You'll have to add mushrooms though, which in my opinion, makes the dish! I've no inkling of pricing since the company orders and picks it up. But if you need a sandwich caterer in Irvine, CPK is a good choice!

Came here for a birthday with 40 people.  Food was average... I like their pizza but now a days you can find similar thin crust pizzas for much cheaper and taste better ( I find CPK's pizza crust to be a little too chewy).  Although their pizzas do have a good variety of flavors. The biggest problem was that they wouldn't split the bill for our party of 40... I mean at least into groups of like 10 or something would have been nice.  It was a pain and hassle to have to push the bill down with cards and cash and I ended up having to pick up the short change.  Other than that the service was fine.  Additionally, the reservation for 40 saved us after being turned down everywhere else so I can't be too upset

This place is closed.  Its funny...my 1st job was across the street at what used to be a factory for aerospace parts. Now it is condos. I remember thinking "I arrived" the one and only time I ate here. Been to a few other locations but this is where I 1st tried CPK.
Still love this place and Fernando!!! Come to CPK and sit at the bar and have a laugh with food and drinks.  Fernando will supply all of that!

Worst service ever. I have been treated better at a McDonalds in Anaheim.  My server acted like my brothers and friends weren't good enough to be served. Her name is Kristen and she was so condescending and was not friendly at all. It's as if she couldn't give good service to Asians. She was only friendly and smiled at other tables filled with Caucasians.  She also ignored us whenever we'd make eye contact and raise our hands for more water or for more help.  To make it worse, she charged me extra for a free appetizer when she clearly stated she would do it. After, the manager who helped with my refund was patronizing and treated me like a 5 year old.  Thanks CPK.

Would be getting 4 stars, but service SUCKS!  Even though the bread is free, you gotta ask the server for it; otherwise, they won't serve it to you.  Favorite: 1. Lettuce cup with chicken - the crunchiness from one of the veggies inside is a perfect crunch that goes with the rest of the stuffing inside. Got it without the rice noodles b.c. they taste like styrofoam. Ask for extra lettuce cause they never give you enough.  2. Kao Pao Spagetti - sounds weird? that's cause you haven't tried it it. Chicken and peanuts cooked in spicy oil and tossed with spaghetti... perfect for days when you're craving for both Asian & Italian.  3. Wadrof Chicken Salad - the best salad on the menu. Different greens all toss together with chicken, grapes, blue cheese, and walnut~ yummy!  Get the vinaigrette, that's the best dressing they got! Tip: Ask for bread or you wont' get any~

Service was very average.  We had to ask for water, bread & butter, and had to track down the waitress so we could order even though it was late and it wasn't very crowded. Ordered mac and cheese balls and chicken quesadilla small bites to start.  Both were pretty good.  The deep fried mac and cheese was very cheesy and delicious.  Then we ordered chipotle pizza and broccoli sun-dried tomato fusilli.  This pizza is one of my favorites; it has a very nice spicy kick to it.  The pasta was decent.  Nothing amazing but not bad either.   Cpk is a go to restaurant where you know the food will be decent.  Some locations have better service though.

CPK is a chain so there's not much to say about the food unless really you haven't been to one.  A group of three girls ordered a thai crunch salad full size plus avocado and buffalo chicken pizza. The meal is filling enough for us (since there's also bread served beforehand). The two dishes were a good combo.  What was good about the place was the FAST service. Everything was quick. If you want to get in and get out this is your place. It wasn't packed the day I went, Thursday night, so I didn't feel rushed despite the fast pace.

Just what you would expect, and excellent service.  Friendly staff, clean and inviting atmosphere.  Food is always up to par. Just a suggestion: the new gluten-free menu is terrible. I love gluten-free pizza, but the attempt by CPK falls way short.

NOOOOOOOOOO. NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO. THEY STOPPED MAKING THE CHICKEN AND GARLIC PIZZA. I WAS SO CRUSHED. I'd come here with my friend thinking that I was going to get the garlic chicken pizza, but I couldn't find it on the menu. I asked the waiter when he came around with our waters, and he told us that they were no longer making it. The good thing is that we found out that day that you can add onions and garlic on your pizza for free! So, feeling less devastated, we decided to go meaty and got the Meat Craver's pizza, and added garlic on top. We also got the Tuscan Hummus, which I quite enjoy. The food was yummy and service was prompt. I did think that the crust was a little too thin for my liking, but it was perfectly baked and just the right amount of crispy, so that's a bonus. Our waiter was really nice and really fast. We came in for a quick lunch and we got just that. We left satisfied. I'll be back, especially now that I know that I can add garlic to all of my pizzas.

Came here for dinner since we were in the area and I had a giftcard. It was an early and it was a weekday so they weren't too busy. The host was busy with his thick textbook -- reminded me of West's Business Law. So we got seated and asked for drinks.  I was curious with the Italian sodas so I ordered a Peach one. It came with too much ice (refer to pic) and tasted like 7up/Sprite with peach flavoring. We ordered two pizzas, Habanero and thin crust Sicilian. How is it that their thin crust is more expensive than regular crust? When the pizzas arrived, the thin crust appeared to be larger than the regular. Habanero was nothing to rave about until you add the sauce/salsa that comes with it. Oh so spicy and yet just the right kick the pizza needed. The Sicilian wasn't as exciting. Slices of meat thicker than the crust itself seems like an accurate description. I don't think I'd ever be a fan of thin crust. Service was good. Didn't even have to ask for refills as the server just comes with a new glass. Wondered what she would have done if I refused it. $40 for two pizzas and two drinks?  Sorry CPK, I think I'm sticking to my local pizza place. PS. What's up with the half booths?

It has been long time I didn't visit cpk.I am Glad that I did . They have new kind of bread and olive oil next to it. I got four cheese ravioli and love it ,cheese pizza could be better ,kung pya was delicious. Server was very fast and kind ,will be back soon again .

I came here last week, on Friday, for lunch with a group... I believe the reservation was made for 14, and we ended up being 12. Our waitress was amazing... her name is Monique.  She was so cheery and fast and attentive.  We had a few appetizers, always had full drinks, our food came out fast... seriously the event was flawless!! Everyone really enjoyed their food as well.  I had the roasted garlic chicken pizza, with extra garlic :)  So delicious!  The pasta dishes looked really good as well.

I was very impressed with the great service and friendliness of the wait staff! i would definitely return to this location again! And I wouldn't think twice about being in a large party. I visited this location on Sunday 4/20 to celebrate a friend's birthday, there were 40+ in our party, we sat outside on the patio! The wait staff was great! Friendly, attentive and had a great customer service attitude.  And the orders were delivered in a timely fashion.  What I also thought was smart, was instead of having one bill for all of us or breaking it into the 2 separate bills for the two tables, the waitress compartmentalized the entire bill to only 8 people's orders per bill and by doing so, it was less hectic at the end of the evening.  Also, once the sun went down and the evening became cooler, the heat lamps were turned on. I don't doubt many of us appreciated it.

While staying at a hotel in Irvine, the evening of 3/9/14 we ordered for delivery a Margherita pizza in the only size offered. We were quoted $14.03 (inc. tax) for the pizza + the outrageous sum of $10.00 for delivery.  Not having a car, we agreed to the total cost of $24.03.  Delivery was sooner than expected; plates, napkins and plastic silverware were provided as well as 4 pieces of bread and olive oil for dipping. The delivery guy left, but immediately returned to inform us the total was $14.83 and that the amount we gave him was 80 cents short.  I have in front of me the note I wrote when I placed my phone order, their clerk clearly said $14.03 for the pizza + $10.00 for delivery for a grand total of $24.03 and I repeated this back to her.  I have no idea how the delivery guy came up with a shortage of 80 cents, but we paid. We immediately proceeded to serve the pizza and found it to be completely, totally and disgustingly cold.  Not lukewarm, but cold almost like pizza out of a refrigerator.  This hotel room has a small microwave, but we're not fans of microwaved pizza so we ate it cold.  Unfortunately, we paid cash so we had no recourse but to 'eat' the loss. I called and spoke to Lacy who said she was the manager.  I asked if their pizzas are placed inside insulated transport bags like Domino's uses, she said they use those bags but that perhaps our delivery guy took it out of the bag once he arrived at our lot.  It shouldn't take more than 5 minutes to walk from the hotel lobby to our room, so I can't see how a 5 minute walk could cause a hot pizza to suddenly become cold.  I told her they need to review this policy and that the insulated bag should be used up until the moment of delivery.  I also mentioned the 80 cent discrepancy. The pizza was edible and I'd classify it as good but, who enjoys eating cold pizza?  We're very, very disappointed with this expensive experience, it's our first time ordering delivery from this chain.  I don't know if charging the outrageous sum of $10.00 for delivery of a $12.99 pizza is a California thing or if this is a common occurrence with this chain.  I don't plan on ordering takeout from this chain ever again.  By the way, I called Domino's after-the-fact to ask about the cost of its delivery, it's $2.50.

hmmm... I don't usually review big chain places, because I mean... CPK is CPK. You kind of know what you're getting. However, a recent visit prompted me to write this review.  Service was def lackluster despite being a relatively slow weekday evening. Server didn't come around too much.  I ordered the Baja Chicken Tortilla rolls and the Thai Chicken rolls. I ordered it because I wanted chicken. They should rename it Baja Tortilla Roll etc. Take a look at my photo. The roll had only two pieces of chicken, which were the same size as a black bean. Woah. talk about stingy stinge! How can you even cut chicken to be that small!  mehhhhhhhhhhhh overpirced!!!!
Very busy at lunch, since a lot of local business around. Servers are great and attentive. Park is bad so recommend car pool if coming with a group during the lunch rush.
Average pizza. Average service. Average place. For 16 bucks I would rather have ordered a large papa johns at home. Pretty greasy too

Readers, I don't frequent chain restaurants very often but when I do, I make sure to keep my expectations in check.  Today, I decided to order takeout because they would give 20% of my tab to the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation.  So I called in orders for myself and my coworkers and off I went to pick up our food. (Side note: People, if you're not going to be there for 15 minutes or less, please refrain from filling up the curbside service or takeout parking space!!) The takeout counter which is to the right of the hostess stand provides an easy convenient space to pick up orders and place orders.  The guys running the counter were very helpful and nice.  The food was ready when we got there and bread was offered and accepted. I had their grilled vegetable salad which sounds great on paper - grilled eggplant, grilled zucchini and asparagus served warm over romaine lettuce and topped with avocado chunks and toss with a dijon vinaigrette.  With the avo, the salad got ... mushy...when you stirred it up.  Flavor was as expected, nothing mind boggling.  I'm not normally a fast eater but my workload combined with the uninspired food fare allowed me to shove half my salad down my gullet in record time. My friend's chicken tequila fettuccine was standard/tasty.  The pasta was cooked perfectly and properly seasoned. Biggest highlight of lunch: Butter that was provided with the bread service was delightfully room temperature which made it very spreadable. Final assessment: Service, speediness of takeout and the butter were all 4-star worthy.  The standard fare drops it to a solid 3. But...it was for a good cause.

Catered with this CPK again and once again they forgot plates. What do they expect people to eat off of?  All catering provides plates and utensils. Why is that so hard for this cpk to understand.they were also 5 minutes late and I had to wait another 5 minutes for them to hunt for plates. Then he came running out to my car as I was driving away with the salad that he forgot.

Came here on a slow Monday night with a group of 9. Had pretty decent dinner. I'll start with the positives. Service was speedy and our food for the entire table was up in about 10 minutes. Good thing, cuz we were hungry. The thai spring rolls were very flavorful although some may think the sauces are a little too salty. Spinach and artichoke dip was warm and cheesy. Tortilla and mushroom soup was good too. And if you are in the mood for dessert, order the tiramisu, best one I've had at a restaraunt. It saved this restaraunt from being 3 stars in my book. Negatives: I ordered the gorgonzola and pear pizza with the wheat crust. Bland bland bland. I was craving the gorgonzola, but didn't really taste it anywhere. I surely could taste the roasted hazelnuts though, which didn't really fly with me. At least the crust was a nice texture. Our waitress didn't seem too happy to be there either. Walked around with a stern look glued to her face. Maybe we just caught her on a bad night. Overall none of the food was too stand out excellent for the evening. Also a suggestion for the restaraunt: invest in some heating elements above the food for when it comes out of the oven. If it sits on a cold counter top in an air conditioned building it's going to get real cold real fast before it hits the table.

I went here for my Cousin's baby naming.  It was a very clean restaurant, lots of space and windows.  The appetizers were okay; we had the spinach dip and avocado rolls.  They were good, but probably very unhealthy.  The vegetable salad was also pretty good, but it had a bit too much dressing on it.  The garlic chicken pizza was decent, but did not amaze me.  It was all around a good meal.  I was surprised that they had Sculpin on tap, so that was a good bonus.
This place is INSANE when it comes to parking. I would much rather avoid the madness than eat here.

What else is there to say about a CPK? If you've been to one, you've been to all... Well, almost. I must say that I do like the set up of this particular branch. Their format is systematic and effective. In which they should, since they have to partake in a volley of mass lunch rushes everyday. From the white collar folk to the UCI students to Irvine residents, they can get you in and out without feeling like your share of service was shortchanged... What I do find to my liking is that they now have nutrition facts available for the calorie conscious individuals. Very nice. On the day I went here, I ordered a roasted artichoke spinach pizza and a traditional cheese (for the little one). At 10:30 am, we were just in time before the rush. If you fancy some hot sauce for your pizza, they carry Cholula.  Our waitress had provided us with prompt and intuitive service. Very much appreciated. With so many positivities, a 4 star instead of 3! Keep up the good work!

CPK is my favorite restaurant in the WORLD.  And this particular restaurant is the best one I've been to, in good ole' Irvine.  I know there's 2 others in Irvine but this is the best-it's never busy with a long wait like the others, so it's home-y, it's quick, efficient, and all the workers are great (a rarity, hence the outstanding ovation). I've come here with 1-30 people, for big parties they'll seat you in the back and still be quick with your orders.  You can also be as loud as you want which is good to hear.  The service is always good.  And actually, I've had the service be a BIT slow a couple of times and both times, the manager's randomly come out and just given me any complimentary dessert of my choice.  Now that's how you work it. I love the Santa Fe Chicken Pizza, probably because I just LOVE sour cream, salsa, and guacamole.  The BBQ chicken's a classic but gets old.  My friend loves the avocado egg rolls.  The dumpling sauce makes it that much better, the cobb salad is delicious, so's the pastas...okay, I just love this place.  CPK FOR LIFE.
I tried to get sun dried tomato and broccoli fusilli. The company removed it from the menu but all other locations have been able to make it. This location refused.

Always a nice generic lunch place for my coworkers and I, the only thing is..  they're usually two hour lunches if we go with more than 4 people.  You have to ask for bread now. Sicilian Pizza - thin crust chewy not too crunchy, tons of delicious meat, fresh basil (ask for extra) BBQ Chicken Pizza - Chicken can be dry sometimes but its good Champagne vinagrette is delicious
Pretty good, we ordered food to go took ten minutes. Watch the parking lot, parking violators enforce.

I work in the office building near this CPK so I decided to order by phone and come pick it up when my lunch started. So I call in and am prompted by one of the employees who was very kind in taking my order. He did not try to force any extras on me which is always a plus. I ordered a Sicilian pizza, kind of expensive which is why one start is lost, but the rest of the experience was pretty good. He estimated it would be ready about 20-25 minutes after putting the order in. So I show up at around the 15-20 minute mark and paid for my pizza, complimentary bread included.  All in all it was a painless experience. If you're working close to here and need a quick and delicious but don't mind it being a too expensive of a lunch.. then go for CPK.

Its CPK.. What more is there to say? Its a place you go to if you want to grab a decent meal. If I go to any CPK, I order one thing. That is the Chicken Tequila Pasta. Simply my favorite thing at CPK. Food is always going to be decent. I love the Spinach Artichoke dip also. Its definitely a safe place to eat.

Located across the globe there are about 256 working restaurants filling the hungry stomachs of all ages. California Pizza Kitchen is a casual setting fit for family dinners to a night out on the town. The sit down restaurant has lots of light with large windows and famous pictures of pizza framed and hung around the booths to create conversation with anyone. If your looking for a quick drink and an appetizer there is an option of the bar that sits across from the kitchen so you could smell the mouthwatering food that is placed on a metal shelf waiting to be served. If not there is also a selection of outside seating, booths, or tables to choose from.   The menu consists of multiple pages categorized into pizza, pasta, salad and much more. With all these options it's almost impossible to choose from but there's nothing better than the soft crust of the tostada pizza. Layers of black beans, fresh romaine lettuce, tomatoes and crisp chips all make up this signature dish. It's a hearty mix of salad and pizza warmed to perfection making sure to fulfill your every craving. If all of that isn't enough there is an option of adding slow roasted chicken with a taint layer of sweet barbeque sauce. All of this served cut into 8 slices to share.  To refresh yourself make sure to order the Shirley temple crusted with soft sugar and topped with a cherry or even two if you're lucky. This drink is just the right thing to clean your palate to get ready for dessert. There are about 8 different desserts to choose from including Tiramisu, Butter Cake and sugary Red Velvet Cake but if you ask any server they recommend the Butter Cake and so would I. This dish is something I could eat every day for breakfast lunch and dinner if it wasn't for the massive amount of calories. The calories are well worth it though! The warm cake is moist and spongy baked to perfection and laced with, what other than butter! Served with a scoop of none other than vanilla ice cream that drips down the hot cake and melts in your mouth. This is something you can't pass up! California Pizza Kitchen is a great place to eat and will always keep you coming back!

I always get the same thing, Ive never had an issue. lol 1/2 order of: BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad.  Extra corn.  Add Avocado.  NO BEANS.  And Extra Ranch. Mmmm, makes my mouth water thinking about it. :) The lettuce and ingredients are always fresh and yummy. The Peach Lemonade is to die for.

California Pizza is a safe standby place. It is not anything special but is easy to eat and appeals to a lot of different people. This location is off of Jamboree and 405, close to Ruth Chris Steakhouse. Parking here is stupid.  The interior is the mirror of any other CPK; the place is usually clean and spacious. The kitchen is open so you can see the wood fired ovens. whoopie! (add sarcasm).  The staff are friendly but sometimes spacey. Overall good customer service.  The food as stated before is not anything special but there are a lot of options. The pizza are easily big enough to split with someone. For health conscious people, they do have nutrition information available but just like every other restaurant, it is brutal. I enjoy the field greens salad and BBQ chicken pizza. The tostada pizza is also good.  Price is OK. I am usually satisfied when leaving but could probably get the same for cheaper somewhere else.  Overall, I come to CPK occasionally but not a regular. Always satisfied when leaving.

I love this CPK. Everyone is so friendly.  The bartender RJ is such a great asset to CPK he is very welcoming and makes the best drinks. I refuse to go to any other CPK'S. Thank you Irvine CPK you ROCK.
We have been to a lot of CPKs and this one has the best service we have ever had. And the food was very tasty.

We came at 6ish on a Friday and the wait was only 10-15 mins for two people. My bf and I finished this dinner within 10 mins. We weren't that starving, but we didn't want to miss our movie. Even afterwards, we could still eat more.. Chicken Tequila Fettuccine = yummmmmy I wish the portion was a bit bigger and the chicken was dry but that sauce was so good. Buffalo Chicken Pizza = It was decent, but compared to the pasta it needed more of a kick to it.  Service: Alright- The waitress didn't bring out the bread so we had to ask. By the time she brought it out, our food was here.

Unbeknown to many people, a woman and a pizza have a lot in common.   For one, they both smell good and you can't get enough of their aroma.  You always stop and think to your self, "What is that delightful smell?". Also, they are best when they are hot.  Hot women and hot pizza?  Score. Third, if you have the cash you can always order them to come to your door and discard them when you're done.   When you have too much of one you quickly get sick of it and start to look at other options. Men like 'em with big toppings. They both can come with crabs.

Not sure what happened, but last time we were here we ordered a BBQ chicken pizza and it seemed considerably smaller than usual. I know I have a big appetite, but I don't think its me...I think the pizza really did get smaller. I've also noticed that the prices have gone up at least a couple dollars per pizza in the past couple years. I know pizza ingredients have gotten more expensive lately and so the cost of producing a pizza may has gone up, but I don't always necessarily feel like I'm getting my money's worth when I'm coming here. The food is good, but I expect a little more from a place that costs $40-50 for two people to eat.  However, I must say that the peach lemonade here is one of my favorite drinks at a sit-down restaurant besides the freckled lemoade from Red Robin. The chipotle chicken pizza, the california club, and the BBQ chicken are my three favorite pizzas here, and I would also recommend the chicken fettucine. As for the service, it's never great nor is it ever awful.

Had the chicken picatta was very tender however by the time I got to the 3rd piece it had a funky metal taste that was not pleasant to the palette, had the new bread with EVOO & crushed red peppers and added parm cheese and washed it all down w/the Colby Red Wine. Walked away paying $33.16 [tax & tip] wasn't bad but for CPK on the higher side.

I came here today with a friend and we ordered the white corn guacamole with chips and a bbq chicken gluten free pizza.  First of all when we came in around 3, it was pretty SLOW, there were not that many customers so we thought we would be done eating within an hour. However when we finished our chips, our server at no point came up to us and updated us on how long the pizza was going to take, we were literally sitting there for about 20 minutes waiting. When she finally brought the pizza out to us, she had forgotten to mention that a gluten free pizza takes a little bit longer than usual. She should have told us that when we first ordered considering that we might have somewhere to go afterwards which we did. She didn't even bring us plates, we had to ask her when she came back with the cheese and pepper shakers.  When we were done with the pizza, our server was no where to be found! We asked another guy to bring us the bill and he said he would go look for her. He obviously didn't find her because we were sitting there for another 10-15 minutes just waiting on our bill. What he could've done was just bring us the bill when we asked for it because that's all we wanted. Then we just decided to just go to the front desk and pay. Another guy was ringing us out and was apologizing for what was going on. It was pretty ridiculous how no one offered to check up on us while we were just sitting waiting patiently for our bill which never came.  This is seriously the SLOWEST customer service we have ever came across. We were there for about 2 hours and we didn't even order that big of a meal.  What was even more rude and disrespectful was when we were walking towards our car in the parking lot, we saw our server and the guy who was looking for her outside in the parking lot having a conversation. The first thing the guy asks us was did we pay? ARE YOU SERIOUS OF COURSE WE PAID, WHAT DO WE LOOK LIKE TO YOU NOT PAYING?! YEAH YOUR CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKED, WE SHOULDN'T EVEN HAVE PAID TO BE HONEST. That was the first thing he asked us when he saw us, he should have apologized for keeping us waiting when we just simply asked for the bill.  If I can give this place no stars I really would instead of 1, they don't even deserve a 1 to be honest. NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN!

I don't really review that many chain restaurants on Yelp, but I was really satisfied with the service and food at this particular CPK :) I never had to ask for a refill-not even ONCE, and I came in with my best friend literally 30 minutes before closing and they were still super polite and friendly. (Even though I bet they were annoyed we came in so late :\)  I ordered the Sicilian pizza which is my favorite! Other thin crust pizzas just can't beat the Sicilian! My best friend ordered the Chicken Tequila Fettucini which is also delicious :)  We ordered the chocolate souffle cake with a scoop of vanilla ice cream for dessert. asdjahdjkasdhsjak YUM Only order this is you're a chocolate lover (obviously) but holy crap, it hit the spot forsure. Next time I'm ordering the red velvet cake heheheeeee  & I gotta mention that I like the way this CPK is built! It looks wayy cooler than the ones I've been to - the architecture is really interesting! it looks so modern on the outside! I really like it :)

I LOVE coming to CPK.  I've been coming to this location for years (like 8+ years).  It's better than the one in the Tustin Marketplace.  Service is amazing and so accommodating with people that have kids (strollers).   Even my 4 year old asks to go to eat at CPK.  She knows exactly what to order (Mac and Cheese with the free bread and butter).  Her order also comes with a drink (chocolate milk) and desert (vanilla sundae).  That's her usual order and trust me, she always reminds the server about the free bread.   As for me, their Mango Peach Iced Tea Mix is the best!!  Love it!  I stick with my usual of Spaghetti Bolognese with mushrooms.   Funny how I never order pizza at CPK.  But that's my husband's department.  He loves their thin crust gourmet pizza.  And I like their pizza when I take it to work for lunch the next day.  Pretty tasty reheated! Overall, I enjoy coming here because of the ambiance and the amazing service.

Everything on the new menu is excellent and not your typical pizza restaurant. I highly recommend the  chicken lettuce wraps. The chicken chimichurri dinner was also done to perfection and low carb (only 330 Calories) served with fresh grilled vegetable. The service was the best that we have had in a long time anywhere. Make sure to ask for Colleen! She was attentive, funny, and all of her recommendations were the best.

This place is nice, clean, enough space on Saturday night as well. The only complain I have is that they ran out of butter.... I mean seriously you would give us bread but no butter :( Its just sad franchise restaurant like this one can ran out of such a small item... ok Enough with butter now, let it be I guess.... Waitress are very friendly there, I would give 10 out of 10 for the service, They dont bother you much, takes really good care of their customers. I really liked it. The girl from front who greet us, was such a beautiful, she had the most amazing eyes I have ever seen. haha But no seriously, Food is amazing and and they dont take long time to cook either, decent timing. But I was disappointed that they ran out of butter :( so only 3 stars

Been a long time since I went to cpk, the restaurant is located in the place right next to 405 off jamboree. Me and my friend ordered Thai and BBQ chicken, I have to say they were both amazing. On the other hand, the pasta was alright, nothing too special. The server for our table was pretty attentive, our water glasses were never empty !  The restaurant might be crowded during the dinner hours, i would suggest coming here a bit early to avoid the wait.
Good food & good for groups, but their parking lot is a NIGHTMARE. The entire parking lot for all the shops has been re-vamped, but it still sucks.

The atmosphere is very open and casual. They have a gluten-free menu for those who are gluten sensitive, like me. The gluten-free pizzas are delicious, and I recommend the mango iced tea. The chile relleno is also a delicious choice. At the end, they do you the favor of packaging your leftover food for you, rather than just giving you the boxes for you to fill it yourself, like some restaurants. The prices are excellent and affordable. One dollar sign, as advertised.

I've been to this CPK a number of times for group dinners and it never disapoints, whether I'm dining with 5 or 30. Service is always top-notch, just make sure to tell them to split the check at the end. It also looks pretty fancy for a CPK, which is also why it's perfect for both groups and dates. Food is the usually CPK selection. I am personally not a pizza person, but I have always been impressed with their other selections, like the Waldorf Salad, Roasted Vegetable Salad, and Mango Iced Tea.
First time here and I have to say it was pretty mediocre. The pizza was very greasy and honestly tasted a little "sloppy" if you will. I prefer the taste of Dominos personally.

I always go to CPK to eat and the menu has been good enough for me to try again. But last night was a terrible time that make me rethink my usual place.  It was Sunday and there were just tons of people.  The manager probably stressed out but I got a party of 6, with kids and pregnant woman waiting.  It's not nice to make us wait when there are tables available pretending the restaurant is busy. The food is not as good as before and I will definitely reconsider any restaurant...

i went here for two of my friends and shared the cobb salad and jambalaya pasta. they were pretty filling. we had the vinegrette dressing for the cobb salad... possibly not such a good choice.. the sauce for jambalaya was little too much,,, but the service was excellent

My coworkers and I went to show our support for Ronald McDonald House today (CPK is donating 20% of the check if you provide a flyer).  I got the half order of Waldorf Chicken Salad and it was drenched in the vinegrette so I drank lots of water.  I'm glad it was the vinegrette and not the bleu cheese dressing.  Our server was prompt, though.  It was an ok experience.

This is the Fanciest CPK I've been to, the interior design and overall environment was really good. Service was so so, when I arrived, the person didn't even ask me if I wanted to dine in or order take out(I was dining in), and I was very confused with their ordering system. The waiter was really nice, but a little bit too nice and often asking me about my satisfaction. Mango Ice Tea was good and was refillable ;) Overall I had a decent experience at this place. I was very full when I left. Recommended if you like pizza. duh

Not the best place to grab a pizza, but it conveniently located next to my work. It's never too busy during lunch time and the servers are nice. I usually just come here for the BBQ chicken pizza, but i don't think it is really worth it for the price.

I'm definitely not happy about my latest trip to CPK.  My biggest complaint is the Chicken Tequila Fettuccine.  The noodle was either dry or under-cooked, the ingredients were lacking, there was not enough sauce, and the consistency of the sauce was off.  This place, it seems, has gone a little downhill in the past few years.  Now I won't even go here if I get a 20% discount from gift cards that I can purchase through Costco.

I've never been THAT impressed with California Pizza Kitchen.  What is California Pizza anyway??  Can someone please open a GOOD NY Style Pizzeria in the OC?  That would seriously make my year! More often than not I always stick with the BBQ Chicken Pizza here, it is also their most popular pizza item.  I've tried their Mango Tandoori Chicken and Carne Asada pizzas too and was not a fan.  I've also bought the frozen CPK pizzas from supermarkets before and I swear those taste nearly the same as the in store pizzas.  Nothing special at all about CPK.  Overpriced with mediocre food... not to mention the parking in this plaza is HORRIBLE during lunch and dinner hours!!  Be prepared to search 10-15 minutes for a parking space. The reason for the bad rating is because one time I got massive food poisoning here!!  I ate their lettuce wraps and I think it must've been stir fried in some weird oil or they added an ingredient that I wasn't aware of and I broke out in MASSIVE HIVES.  I still have a picture of these bright red, giant bumps on my arms and legs.  It was the worst experience of my life.  My stomach cramped up so bad that I immediately hugged my stomach and someone else had to drive me back home.  I laid in bed all day and could not get up - I was shivering and soaked in sweat too.  It was scary. I think CPK has okay food, but I'll never dare order their lettuce wraps ever again.  Their lettuce wraps are made of minced chicken, shiitake mushrooms, and chopped water chestnuts.  To this day I'm still not sure what exactly made me break out like a maniac...

Ordered 3 things. Hawaiian barbecue chicken pizza.  White Pizza Salad The hawaiian barbecue pizza is really good and the white pizza was a little bit too heavy and creamy. I also drank a Lemon Drop and Long Island, both made strong and to my liking (: The service here is pretty good and the pizzas came out pretty fast.  Great sit down pizza location!

We came in with a party of 6 to celebrate a friend's brithday, all I can say is that Cpk is still got it! :) We ordered: Appetizers: (8/10) - Chicken dumplings  - Flat bread of some sort... Main Course: (9/10) - Hawaiian BBQ Pizza - Jambalaya - The Tostada Pizza It's been a while since my last outing to Cpk but after all that food for 6, the bill came out to about $55 with some of us ordering drinks.  Mind you that they've got the special going where you order an appetizer from the menu and the second one you get for free.  With the Costco gift card we walked away paying $45 for the entire meal.  The entrees were good, although now smaller in portion in comparison to what they've have them before but the prices remain the same!   I would say that it is not a place where you wanna take your date to on a fancy dinner but if you just wanna hang out with some friends at a restaurant that's bright and upbeat while not burning your wallet this spot is still a prime choice to consider!  I'm a fan...still!

This CPK is pretty hidden, so its probably why there isn't a lot of people out for dinner in the area, but we shall see, since there are new additions around the plaza. My friends came here for our weekly dinner this week. They ended up getting  the Hawaiian BBQ pizza together, while I got the Caesar salad. I didn't try the pizza, but its pretty good, for a split, considering it takes up a extra large plate. One of my friends was near full, but we all had room for the delicious tiramisu. My salad was over dressed with asiago cheese, but since I love it, it didn't really matter to me. The half size was pretty filling too, so if you're craving salad, I suggest going for the full size. The tiramisu was packed with flavor. None of the rum hand espresso missing. It was in your face, good. Just the right filling and flavor, probably makes it in the top of my tiramisu goodness.  Overall, CPK is a nice place for a quiet dinner and food, who's flavor that pops with the unusual combinations as compared to the typical pizza joints.  PS: They used to serve bread before the food came out, and now, I've noticed that they haven't, so if you want your bread, and you know they usually hand it out, ASK!
California Pizza - why did you close this location.  It was so convenient and one of the best CA Pizzas around.  Now we have to drive miles from Irvine to find another.  Sorry to see this one go!

I haven't been to cpk in at least a year or more so it was interesting to come back.  I ordered my fave the garlic chicken which has since changed since the last time I remember with more garlic, green onions and onions on the pizza. Also tried their flatbread spinach and mushroom  and my normal bbq chicken salad.. All in all the carb over load was good and getting a free small plate and drink with the pizza dough card is not a bad option.   I went here on a tuesday night took a few minutes to be served but it was good.

Came here during lunch and you could tell- my pizza came out burned on one side and undercooked and the other, but it wasn't terrible. Sat at the bar so I got seated quickly and the service was excellent. Overall, not bad, standard CPK. Just don't come right at 12.

The food is good, and our server was friendly -- it's definitely a chain, but better than say, Coco's. There's a slight Californian twist on the foods, thus inspiring the name. I would probably visit this location again with family, but it's not my usual spot or restaurant of choice. Just as a warning for any iced-tea lovers, their fruit-flavored teas are VERY sweet! I like regular ol' iced tea and even sweet tea, but this was a little too sacharine for my palette.

After 100 plus visits to CPK's all over the United States I decided to try something a little different. Guess what, I did not really care for it. The manager noticed that I did not like it and reminded me about a policy that they have where CPK encourages their regular customers to try new things and if you don't like it, its free. WOW!!

what do you want me to say? it's CPK!  Get it? It rhymes =P Probably my favorite chain restaurant aside from cheesecake. But that being said, parking is alright at this location, albeit crowded on busy nights. The restaurant itself is pretty big, but we had pretty good service during our dining experience. Typical CPK - A-OK!!

I've only sat at the bar area and the service was pretty quick since my friend and I were the only ones there that day. We came around 6:30pm on a Wednesday looking for a quick meal. The waiter at the front seated us as soon as we walked in and everything was fine and dandy after that. We got shared the Kung Pao Spaghetti with chicken and Fried Mac and Cheese. The fried mac and cheese was good as an appetizer (as we drank our wine) and the kung pao spaghetti was pretty good for what it was... Italian-Chinese fusion (what was I expecting???). They skimped out on chicken so I'm probably never going to pay even more for the shrimp or chicken and shrimp options they offer. I'm giving this place 4 stars because all I wanted that day was a quick meal (less than 40 minutes) and that's what I got. The food was okay, but service was good so yay.

CPK is a classic American chain that will have options for most people. Their pizzas and salads are the best options when you come here, while the rest of the menu is generally just ok.  The pizza's have recently changed recipe because the chain has decided to go more "artisan." With this the pizza crust has changed a little, they have more toppings then they use to, and the toppings are not as evenly placed or as evenly cut as they used to be. Personally I preferred the old style much better, but the new style still has a good taste to it.

Horrible experience here. I ordered fish, coming off of a pizza-coma I felt like any more pizza was going to kill me. The ahi was a black-burnt mess, and almost too tough to cut into. The vegetables that came with it were basically frozen vegetables.  My partner's crust was burnt and the waitress was indifferent until it came to tip time. Never coming here again. ALSO:  For those of you who seem curious, the reason why the frozen store version and the restaurant dish taste exactly the same is because THEY'RE THE SAME. Everything at CPK is re-made and shipped to the store to be heated up. If you don't believe me, try and modify something next time you go. They'll say they can't and give you some lame-ass excuse, but the real reason is that they can't pick all those pieces of chicken off a frozen pizza.

Don't opt for curbside service here. You usually have to go find a parking spot and go in anyway.  They also don't enforce that the 2 curbside spots are for curbside service.  I use curbside so I don't have to find a regular spot which can take forever in that sucky parking lot.  Someone needs to come up with a way to effectively mange curbside service--or don't offer it. Food wasn't blah.

I came here with two of my room mates recently to get some pizza.   Got two pizzas, the barbeque chicken and the new spicy korean BBQ pizza.  Both pizzas came out warm.. it wasn't hot enough in my point of view.  The barbeque chicken was okay, nothing really special about it even though that is what they are known for.  I usually get the thin crust, so maybe that was the difference in the pizzas.  The new korean barbeque pizza was just not.. good.  It was a plain pizza topped with cole slaw and some ginger/siracha sauce and I would not recommend getting it.  It was not spicy, flavorless and there was barely any barbeque pork on the pizza itself. Service:  The waitress did not ask to refill our waters once and was pretty slow.  The restaurant was rather empty for a Sunday Lunch afternoon, so I honestly expected the customer service to be better.  We only ordered two pizzas, but she didn't even give us any plates for it.  Service was just really slow and the food was mediocre.

PROS * Very cordial & friendly waiter * Clean, nice atmosphere CONS * I asked for the thickest crust they had and it was quite thin (and a much smaller pizza than my other family members' pizza)  * The crusts were too well done. My family had the (normal I suppose) paper think crusts and the edges were burnt and crunchy.

I think we worked our butts off for this meal, or maybe 200 calories of it! . We had to park at the far end by Target. It was at 8:00 PM, and there were throngs of mostly teens,  They made this huge mall an obstacle course.  Since we are huge micro brew fans, we put ourselves on the waiting list at the Yardhouse.  An hour wait, so we decided to walk to our second choice- Cheesecake Factory, also an hour wait. So, plan C, a distant third choice was PF Chang's. It was an hour wait. Then there was CPK.  Out of desperation, we got on the waiting list, a "mere" 35 minute wait. That might actually work for us.  To keep warm, we did some more walking and window shopping, stopping at the restaurants to check on our wait progress. By the time we got to CPK, 30 minutes had passed. It was enough walking. We decided just to park our butts there and waited to get seated. The young host screamed, "Will --- your table is ready!" Even though we were three booths from the bathroom right near the bar, we were happy to sit. This place is so loud that you could belch and no one would notice!  You could barely hear the muzak system blaring pop classics. The wait persons were a fashion forward bunch with lots of spiked hair, fashionable glasses, tout noir clothes, earrings, etc. And that was just the guys LOL. The place is bright, lively, and fun. Our wait person Jeff was actually quite fast and polite and very good with the refills, stopping to check up on us, etc. He got our drink orders right away, and I was glad they had the Sam Adams Hefeweizen  and Sam Adams Ale, along with a few other beers on tap. My brother had the blue crab cake meal served with a lemony olive oil pasta.  It was actually good not great.  The spices did not overpower the delicately sweet crab meat. My friend had the goat cheese pizza, and I had the Thai Chicken Pizza.  It's sweet and slightly spicy with plenty of cheese and a soft crunchy crust.  The goad cheese with the calamata olives was excellent as well. I've had all their pizzas, and like most of them.  I like how you can add and mix the ingredients in the pizza. Because this is a chain and I've been to about ten of their stores, there was nothing different here in terms of taste and texture, and to me, that's fine.  Another favorite of mine is the Chinese Chicken Salad. They were pushing their Red Velvet cake, but no room in my tummy this time. A few times, some of the men and women drinking too much at the bar walked into the wrong bathroom.  I heard a few, "Oh Sh!!!!yte" exclamations before the patron did a 180 turn, and walking into the right one.  My pizza was $14 and the blue crab dinner was $18. Overall, a good time was had. And it was time to spring forward and walk back to the other end of the mall.
Hadn't been here in a while. They added some new items to their menu. Food was good and service was good also.
We all know this place and it is solid. Always good food every time. My favorite is the Chicken Salad.  Lots of Bleu Cheese. Reliable.

No greeting. no service. No compassion. We left... Family of six. I don't recommend this place. The wait-persons do not prioritize the right way. Three parties who were seated after us got their orders in, way before we even were offered beverages. Don't go to this location... Make the drive to the Irvine Spectrum.

Been a while since I've been here.  I want to say maybe as much as 4 years?  It's possible.  Met up with some colleagues and had some fun catching up.  We all ordered a salad.  I had the cob salad and they had the Italian something or other.  Looked good.  Mine was delicious.  Got the blue cheese dressing on the side.  Our server was really friendly and cool.  They picked up the tab.  Thanks guys!
You know what you're getting with CPK. This is a pretty nice CPK though. Our waitress was really nice.  You have to try the flavoured slushy lemonades! Those are really good.

I really feel like CPK should be on the endangered species list because you can buy frozen CPK pizzas at Ralphs (or the 3-pack at Costco) that taste pretty much like what you get at CPK, minus the server forgetting to refill your drink. The pastas are average at best, and I'm not that crazy about room temperature/cold bread.  Bread should be at least very warm so the butter can melt on it.  If it's not going to be hot, it should taste pretty awesome, which it doesn't. It's all about the thin crust sicilian pizza.  Five bucks at Ralphs, or three for nine bucks at Costco.  DONE.

I don't care about anything else but the ONLY reason why I keep coming back to CPK is because of their Chicken Tequila Fettucine. I've tried this dish at many other places and have not found a better sauce than the one here. It's simply to die for. Who knows what's in it, perhaps it really will kill me, but nevertheless, it's won me over. I like this location because they have a much more architecturally-interesting building and location (notice the bow-trusses and you can see the high-rises around you if you get window seating). But I agree, parking is definitely lacking in this area. I only go when I'm ready to fight for parking...do not go if you have bad parking karma....you WILL go crazy.

Me and my roommate stop by this CPK location every once in awhile since it's pretty close to where we live. I gotta say, I like the atmosphere of this one a lot. It's nicer than other CPK's (somewhat), but at the same time it's still laid back. The supervisors are really nice and seems to make it one of their priorities to talk to the customers and even help them out a bit in addition to the waiters/waitresses. I remember being waited on quite well, and receiving a lot of attention, and a lot more refills than I actually wanted, but hey more is better =)  Expect the same menu at this location that you see at every other CPK location. You get your salads, your pizzas, your pastas, and your drinks. Straightforward, right? The pizzas here are made well, no complaints yet hah. My personal fave on the menu, however, is the pesto cream penne. Sun dried tomatoes are my secret lovers, and you can always have them add chicken to the dish as well. All in all, this location is friendly, comfortable, and in a nice area. No complaints yet. Expect fast service, good food, and easy to find parking. =)
I love CPK. The customer service is great and the food is delicious. Shout out to Amber who was a great server and made our experience!
You can't help but love the BBQ Chicken Chopped salad and the Chicken Tequila Pasta.  I feel like I order this combination way too often but it's always so tasty.  Keep it up.
Friendly service, location is hard to park. Avoid rush hour.

I used to go here all the time.   Some faves: BBQ Chicken Pizza (classic), Carne Asada Pizza, Two-In-A-Bowl with Adobe Chicken Chowder and Sedona Tortilla Soup, Kung Pao Spaghetti, Singapore Shrimp Rolls, Thai Crunch Salad...and the CHOCOLATE SOUFFLE CAKE!! BBQ Chicken Pizza (on Honey Wheat Pizza Dough, you have to request this) Barbecue sauce, smoked Gouda and Mozzarella cheeses, BBQ Chicken, sliced red onions and cilantro (sometimes they forget the cilantro) Carne Asada Pizza... I am a HUGE fan of mexican food.  I grew up in East L.A. and went to a hispanic day care and Pre-school and had authentic Mexican food.  So, when I'm at CPK and I want a Mexican food fix, I get the carne asada pizza.  Don't let them forget the Tomatillo salsa.  IMO, I don't think the fire-roasted green chiles taste good with it, so I ask them to omit it.  When you eat this pizza, it kinda tastes like you're eating a carne asada burrito. Two-In-A-Bowl with Adobe Chicken Chowder and Sedona Tortilla Soup... both soups are good, why only settle for one?  ^^ Kung Pao Spaghetti really does taste like Kung Pao chicken.  It's slightly sweet, has the roasted peanuts, and green onion.  It can be pretty spicy tho, so if you're sensitive to spice, you can ask them to make it not spicy or mild. Singapore Shrimp Rolls come with tender Shrimp, baby broccoli, soy-sauce marinated Shiitake mushrooms, carrots, noodles, bean sprouts, green onion and cilantro wrapped in rice paper. Served chilled with a sesame ginger dipping sauce and Szechuan slaw.  Delicious!  I like the texture of the noodles.  The sauce goes really well with the rolls.  The marinated Shiitake mushrooms are tender and give the rolls a hearty taste. Thai Crunch Salad... this doesn't taste too much like "Thai" food ... more like asian chicken salad.  It has shredded Napa cabbage, chilled-grilled chicken breast, julienne cucumbers, edamame, crispy wontons, peanuts, cilantro, julienne carrots, red cabbage and green onions tossed with a lime-cilantro dressing. Topped with crispy rice sticks and Thai peanut dressing.  Don't let them trick you into adding avocado for $2.50.... maybe that's my cheap inner asian talking.  lol The chocolate souffle cake is wonderful.  It comes with hot fudge, and vanilla bean sauce.  I highly recommend adding the Vanilla Ice Cream.  The vanilla bean sauce is light, creamy and fluffy.  The souffle cake itself is light and chocolatey, but is different from regular chocolate souffle (best chocolate souffle is at Lawrey's/Tam O'Shanters).

Sadly disappointed, came in for a late dinner with friends at my suggestion and received bad service. I ordered a small bite dish, Korean Tacos with spicy sauce on the side. Not too difficult. When the waitress brought it, it had sauce on it which she noticed right away and took back to replace. Great, only problem all my friends ate the whole dinners before my food even came back and we couldn't find anyone to ask about it. Food finally came and manager came to apologize and offered to comp it, or so I thought but when check came taco's were still on check. I had to ask about removing the charge. On top of my food issue, not one of the 5 other guests at our table got a refill on their drinks. Manager finally came back after we had been sitting and chit chatting for quite awhile to offer a dessert to me, but at that point we were getting up to leave. Too l ate too little in my mind.

cold bread. i heard that the grilled peach salad was good but when i ordered it, the salad came with a big bowl of dried cranberries. gross. note to self. next time, stick with the pizza and white sangria.

Not really worth what you pay. Pizzas are smaller, not all that unique or interesting. Upside is that their menu changes regularly, but nothing blows your socks off, ever.  You can order online at   which maximizes the chances that they get your order right amid all the restaurant noise.  Costco currently sells 2 x $50 gift cards for $80.  We ordered the Sicilian which has always been pretty good, the white pizza with Bacon isn't bad either.  The mushroom pizza is better at Zpizza- more depth to the flavors and less one dimensional.  The quinoa and arugula salad's dressing is tasty, but the portions are rinky-dinky.

Okay I went back yesterday for a coworker's birthday and it was pretty good.  I tried the new roasted artichoke and spinach pizza... It was delicious. I love thin crust!  I bump it up 1 star because I easily made lunch reservations for 18 and they sat us out in the patio because they recommended to me that it was going to be a nice day. Thoughtful! We brought a couple of cakes and they happily kept it in the fridge and brought it out when requested with candles and a lighter. Great service! I should always tell everybody I work at UCI.

Okay....so this is a chain. So you pretty much know what you're going to get at this place. I don't think I've ever really had a complaint with CPK food; overall I enjoy it. What sets this place apart is the service (this is primarily what my high rating is for). People are always super friendly, the manager is always wandering around, talking with customers, and helping out wait staff and bussers. Service is prompt, but you don't feel rushed. Everyone really knows the menu, and wil help out with recommendations Once we even had a waitress bring us a free sundae because she said we had been so nice to her. (I think she had a rough night). Funny, I thought WE were supposed to tip HER! (Don't worry, we tipped nicely!)  Horray for nice people! PS - If you come for lunch during the week, be prepared. Parking sucks ass in this complex.

I've had some crappy service at other CPK's, but this one always has friendly and timely service over and over again. Sitting at the bar is nice.  Sitting in the restaurant is nice.  It can get a bit busy for dinner, but that wont stop your waiter from sending helpers to deliver your drinks or food.   All in all, no complaints about this place.  The pizza is great, beer is great and service is great.  I couldn't ask for more from a CPK really!

Have given this CPK a few try's and they just can't seem to be consistent. Recently when we went my wife had the Tricolore Salad and the waiter talked her into adding the Salmon (they are very good at selling add ons), "you need some shoestrings or socks with those shoes sir"? I ordered the Chicken Caesars Sandwich on Foccacia. Her salad was good except for the horrible excuse for Salmon they put on top. It looked like dried out kibble you wouldn't even feed your cat, if you had a cat, which I don't, I prefer dogs...anyway my sandwich with over cooked chicken and a whisper of dressing was so dry I took one bite and sent it back. Manager was apologetic but still charged us for the Salad less the kibble. Didn't earn a repeat visit. It's too bad because we like the Spectrum and for some reason got a bunch of these gift cards over the holidays...call me I will sell em to you cheap.

I ordered a Sicilian pizza and it tasted pretty good, but then I bit into a BONE in the SAUSAGE!!! Ouch. Almost chipped a tooth. I get that stuff happens, but the staff reaction was terrible. My server was the only one to take it seriously. The chef shrugged and turned around when the server told him about it as if this happens all the time. The manager Danielle came by quickly at the server's prompting and then proceeded to say "oh...sorry, we'll tell our chefs" Then she went about her business.  The server tried to fight for a discount on the pizza, but the manager basically said, "we're not doing anything". Glad to see they take this stuff seriously.

i haven't eaten at a CPK in a long time.  I remember the peking duck pizza & the shrimp pizza used to be pretty good.  but they have removed them both from the menu.  I had the burger pizza instead.  it was just OK.  it might have been better if it was hot, but when I got it, it was lukewarm. I guess the waiter waited for all the food to be ready before bringing them out since we had a big party.
Easily the best pizza chain ever! The have foods to satisfy the pickiest child and gourmet pizzas to amaze those with mature food tastes.

Yummy! We walked here for an evening out and I must say we were pleasantly surprised. Our waitress was nice and even though she forgot some of the things we asked for-she made up for it. Also-you gotta try the pumpkin cheesecake! Mmm!
Poor service, waitress took a long time to get our drinks after a long wait.  Our dumplings were cold and the manager didn't really seem to care.

One of my favorite chain restaurants. The transparent glass walls make this location attractive.  During lunch hours, it's bright and airy.   I realize that I only eat four dishes here: the sesame ginger dumplings, the Kung Pao spaghetti, the Thai Linguine and the BLT pizza. The skins of the dumplings are usually soggy but I still like them and I'm not sure why.  The Kung Pao spaghetti has a spicy kick to it and it's wonderful with shrimp.  The Thai Linguine is reminds me of pad thai but with more peanut flavor.  The lettuce on the BLT pizza is nice and cool while the rest of the pizza is delightfully hot.  Their tiramisu isn't half bad either -- no strong rum taste.

I will not go back to this place ever. My husband and I used to frequent this place since we both love their BBQ chicken pizza. But last Tuesday made our minds change. After we got seated, a few more customers came in and immediately got seated and servers rushing to take their orders. I was telling my husband i will give these servers a few more minutes before I ask. Nearly ten minutes passed then I asked one server where the server assigned to our table was. He goes "I will look for the one assigned there". I mean seriously.. Cant they take the table and search for the person later??? We were so mad we stormed out of the place. Dumb manager saw us rushing through the door and when my husband told him why he seemed dumbfounded. Oh well guess we are not going back there anytime soon with the poor service they have!

I am always tempted to taste other items besides the pizza, but their pizza is just so yummy :-) I'm sure someday I will steer away from my standard glass of Chateau St. Michelle Riesling, wedge salad and the Roma Tomato/5 cheese pizza.  Although the pizza is really delicious, I'm giving it 3 stars because sometimes their servers aren't so pleasant. I've had quite a few younger servers that seem to be always be rushed and slammed even though there are 10 people in the restaurant.  Another pet peeve I do have about this CPK is the parking! It's nearly impossible to find a space within the allotted restaurant parking since it's set back inside a small shopping center and really only has 10 assigned spaces. Unless you stalk people walking to their car or (like we did on another occasion) or offer a ride to someone walking back to their car in exchange for their space, you can anticipate driving around for at least 10 min looking for a spot to park.  Prices are usually fair- but do tend to be on the pricey side for some of the specialty pizzas. All in all CPK is a good place for GREAT, thin crust pizza... I wouldn't say it's the healthiest but it sure is DELI SH :-)  OH- I almost forgot- the Strawberry Lemonade is TO DIE FOR! My son ordered it last time and we were left licking the glass dry!

THE GIST: We still feel it's worth the $15 for pizza and $12 for salad! RECOMMENDATIONS: 1) SICILIAN PIZZA: This thin crusted pizza is just so delicious with every bite. The mix of meats on this pizza is salty goodness. We have tried all the pizzas on the menu and the  Sicilian is still our favorite one ever. (btw.. don't buy the frozen version.. not the same AT ALL.. chewy meat is not cool).  2) BBQ CHICKEN SALAD WITH AVOCADO: Okay.. we know it's mostly lettuce in any salad, but this salad is so worth the price.. its got a great taste and you must have it with the dressing, we've tried to go healthy and not have the dressing with it, but it is not the same. The half size is almost as big as the full size, so if you are on a budget, just get the half size because it's still enough to share with two people. 3) RED VELVET CAKE: believe it or not, this place serves a mean red velvet cake with cream cheese frosting. This slice of cake is huge, moist, fresh, and equalizes out the saltiness of the pizza you just ate! SERVICE: The service at this location comes and goes with the different servers that work here. Some are superb and some just straight suck. As long as the food tastes good here (which is always does) we'll still come to this location.
The food was fine. Exactly what I expected for CPK. The service was so-so. Our server didn't really check on us or fill our waters much.

I have never wrapped my brain around the whole CPK thing. I know it's "California" pizza, not real pizza, but even with that level of skepticism walking into the place I still find myself underwhelmed. Still, I'm the only male in my office so being dragged into this place was inevitable since California girls can only go so long without going to CPK, talking about how good the healthier menu items are, and then not ordering them. Anyway, I ordered a pizza with spinach, artichokes, and roasted garlic. It was decent. Not great, and nothing to wow about, but roasted garlic goes a long way sometimes to help things out.
I love their fresh California Club Pizza and a glass of prosecco!   I usually go there when they're not busy.
CPK is never really filling, but the service and pizzas are always fine.

Stylish and open decor but still feels private and comfortable enough.  Great service.  Especially great deal on kids meals!!  Free refills on all kids drinks, dessert for $1, lots of food all for $5.50. Nice pizzas and pasta.  Just a great place to relax for the whole family.  Tustin and Mainplace locations have nice staff as well.  It's just a nice style and environment.

I ordered an Italian Deli. I am not used to eating sandwiches that have a hard bread like that. I mean the service was nice but the sandwich wasn't really worth. Just stick with ordering pizza at CPK and not anything else haha

A go-to place for anyone.  We had appetizers.  The artichoke dip was extremely good.  I've had a lot of group-ordered artichoke dips. This one rivals the others.   I ordered the portobello ravioli and asked for a red sauce instead of the sauces they offered.  It was good.  I liked the calorie counts on the menu.  I felt better about eating my gigantic bowl of pasta knowing it had the least calories of all of the pasta!   The service did well with our large group of 14.  The food was nothing special.  But the standard fare was done well and the service was just fine.

The food was great and tasty, there was soo much to choose from and the wines were great. Its a great place to go on a date or just to hang out with friends. The price of the food is a little costly but its worth it. The location is also great and valet is helpful too.

Why oh why oh why oh why oh why do my friends insist on eating here for lunch???? The food is average and relatively expensive. The wait can be really long, and trying to find a parking spot around there at lunch?? Good luck! Between noon and 1 PM, that parking lot becomes the devil's playground. The absolutely worst thing about this place? THE SERVICE. Slow servers with major attitude.  Why should I spend my (husband's) hard-earned money on a place like this? Sorry guys, friends don't let friends eat at this CPK.

My friend and I had a quick dinner here before I headed back down to San Diego and this location was a little disappointing compared to the ones at home. It might have been because I was exhausted and ready to get home, but who knows? First of all, it took forever to find parking, which I was surprised to see on a late Sunday night. This place is a lot smaller than the ones I've been in but the seating and decor were the same as all of the other ones. We sat outside because the restaurant was too cold for us.  We had the baked mac and cheese craving, hummus & pita bread, tequila lime fetuccini, and full carmelized peach salad. Baked mac and cheese was delicious, it should be a full sized appetizer than just a craving! It comes with 4 pieces which I guess is enough for a "craving" but you'll wish you had more. I wasn't too pleased with the hummus but I'm not that big of a fan of it in the first place. The tequila lime fetuccini is what has me coming back to CPK over and over and over again. It. Is. To. Die. For. so good. Carmelized peach salad was good, the full size is entirely too big for just one person. Good idea to split that between two people. We added bacon to it thinking it would complement the sweetness but it kind of overpowered everything else. I know you can never have too much bacon, but for a salad...it might have been excessive. I also had the red sangria which was a little tarty but good. I think I might stick with the white next time.

First thing first... DO NOT ORDER THEIR JAMBALAYA period! Worst I have ever tried...They serve Jambalaya on noodle, and tiny shrimp + meat were all over cooked...Love that from the BJ's where it was served on rice. Pizza: If you like over sweeten stuff, try their original BBQ chicken pizza. Otherwise, you can still try one of their classics with less souce - highly recommend If you are vegetairan, order their Vegetarian with Japanese Eggplant pizza and mushroom pizza. Tried both and love them both. Appetizers: Lettuce Wraps is weird...not as good as the lettuce wraps from Cheesecake factory. Overall, ok place and service for the money.

There are hits and misses but your safest bet is to get a pizza. It's like ordering steak at a seafood place, CPK does pizza so you're not going to get the best from them if you order kung pao spaghetti.  As for the service, it's only been bad when it's the busiest and if you come in with a large group. I always seem to get this one guy, Socorro, for my waiter whenever I go and have recognized him and remember his name, so it was a big blaring sign that I've frequented CPK one too many times. If you can, get him as your waiter. I never have had to wait long for my orders, he doesn't check the table so often that it gets annoying, and it doesn't take long for him to take care of our table if something is needed.  My favorite pizza to get is the pear & gorgonzola. The website says it's new but they just stopped serving it for awhile and decided to bring it back again. I stopped going after they told me the last time I went that they no longer serve pear/ gorgonzola pizza. That sweet and savory dish was the only reason I frequented this place. So it was pretty surprising that they're advertising the pizza as new since it's not. Maybe they felt the sting of my tummy's vengeance for not providing one of it's favorite meal's. It feels a little empowering actually.  I should boycott NBC so they can bring back F.R.I.E.N.D.S.

This place has the weirdest pizzas. If you haven't ever tried barbaqued chicken pizza, or Thai pizza then you are in for a treat. When you get bored with all the rest, try it out. It is on the expensive side, but it is gourmet, kind of like a Wolfgang Putz. Service here was good, and fast. I was on a 90-minute break from a seminar, and the waiter got us served and out with time to spare. The food is fancy, but the decor isn't.

Aaah, chain restaurants.  Either you like 'em or you don't.  I've been a fan of CPK since I was like 10; I feel like it's a good go to place when you need a quick dinner, you don't want fast food, and you want something relatively healthful.   Anyway so while I can't complain about the quality of the food at this particular CPK, I can complain about their complete inability to manage their take out desk.  (You can take the reservation; you just can't hold the reservation.) Once my husband called in an order and I stood there for 15 minutes while they looked for it because they didn't know Jim was short for James and although I said our last name oh, like 5 times they couldn't find that either. The same thing happened just last week; when I gave our last name, they couldn't find the order although it was clearly on top of the receipt.  I guess my first name Sarah is so long it was just too difficult to read on to the second word following it. They are just dumb, and it's annoying to deal with them.  Summary: food good, service kind of sucky.

Cannot believe this chain is still in business.  But I give it three stars because they have outsmarted all of you for years. Here is a cold, hard fact.  Go to your local grocery store.  Even that scuzzy Ralphs down the block.  Grab one of their CPK FROZEN THIN CRUST PIZZAS.  "The Sicillian" is a good choice (Costco has three packs of these on the cheap).  Buy it.  Now, take this large hockey puck home and put it in your oven at 400 degrees.  Wait ten minutes (twelve if you like crispy crust).  Pull it out. Write me a thank you note and even drop me a few bucks for the time, gas, and annoyance I saved you.  I even spared you the horror of dealing with this parking lot...AND you got a better pizza than the one they would be making you inside....probably fresher too. You're welcome!

My coworkers and I come here from time to time when we have a gap in our schedule.. Giving us at least an hour to grab some food. So.... In the past (at least three times in the past) the service has sucked! Not sure if our last server was stoned but he was really not present. He roamed around as though he was blind. Oblivious that he had a table that was just seated. We had to remind him about our drinks and our food sat out on the counter for a good ten minutes before the tool brought it out. I can be pretty cool about stuff but it's a tad annoying when you have to ask another server for your bread and your salad.....  Now the other night after work I phoned in a to go order . It was not ready as they said it would have been. So, I decided to order a cocktail and read the paper while I waited. I ordered a Vodka Collins.... I was so bummed when I tried it and it tasted like lemon-aid. I guess if I want a good Vodka Collins I will have to go back to The Roost in Atwater Village.......

It's a sad day in Pizza Land when the box set upon my desk containing one CPK Thai Chicken pizza does not make me smile, moan in glee, or profess "HAPPY TIMES!" to the coworkers that share my office space.  Meh. My pizza was cold and the crust was undercooked. There most have been a conspiracy amongst the cubes of chicken en route ....I can only assume.... Since I popped open the top and there they were, huddled in one corner of my pie.  Were they planning escape? Or huddled to protect themselves from the cold that was the crust? Sad, sad day. Especially at 15 bucks for lunch. I'll stick to dining in.

i came here with a group of 18 on easter sunday recently~ the food is probably all the same because its a chain restaurant...so ill go on to describe the service! now, you must be thinking that the service would be terrible, but it was great! we were seated very promptly even though most of our party was not here yet.  we stayed past their closing time, yet did not feel even an ounce of pressure to leave! i felt so bad for our waiter! everyone's food came out at once...well almost everyone.  my pizza came a little later :( its ok though because i eat fast! haha regardless, the service was so great that we didnt even seem to notice they were closing..not until we smelled the odor bleach in the air... anyways..thanks, cpk for remaining open for a large gorup to go out on a boring easter sunday. ^^
CPK is kinda played out in my mind...However I still love coming here for the various chopped salads, they are the best when you want something healthy and light.
