Fabulous food, great service and wonderful staff and management!  Went there with my daughter for a pre-Mother's day relaxing lunch.  Had some fabulous appetizers -- my Sesame Ginger Chicken Dumplings and her's was the fried mac n cheese balls that we learned the staff has been making for years before it came to the menu for us..followed by the Quinoa & Arugula salad and Roasted Veggie salads.  DELISH!  The waiter and manager were very pleasant and personable, sharing experiences and suggestions that made our visit very enjoyable!  We will be back soon!

Mostly the same as other CPK's. It has a shorter wait than usual, though. On a night where the Huntington Beach location had a wait of 30 minutes, this one's wait was less than 10.  I like the Original Barbeque Chicken, Thai, Tandori Chicken, and Jamaican Jerk Chicken. I do NOT recommend the Cajun; it was rather dry and disappointing.
Kid friendly.   The pizza and desert is a hit with the kiddos.  Our waiter was friendly and appropriate with the young ones which made the evening a breeze.  Excellent food although albeit pricey.

been to this place 3 times in my life.  all 3 times had been quite a pleasant experience.   this last time i went, there was something that was quite strange to me.  when we told them we half a semi large party, they asked us if we would like to be seated outside.  we thought it was busy and so we thought outside would be faster.  then we saw a bunch of empty seats inside.  my friends and i thought it was strange.  i wasn't happy about it, but its so small it should not be counted bad toward the restaurant.  she was nice though. service was good and a cute waiter was serving us.  that just gave us girls a little more to talk about.  ;)  i don't want to sound shallow or anything, so i have to say that the overall experience was as good as before.

I go here for lunch about once a month with a friend and we're always pleased.  Creatures of habit, I always order the chicken pesto pizza and he gets the margherita.  Never a complaint.  Flavored iced teas and lemonades are always good, but I don't often order anything to drink and just go with plain old H20 with lemon.  Service is always friendly and for the most part quick.  Another spot where parking can be a pain, but once again, its Irvine at lunchtime.

I have only been here a couple of times, and I am quite satisfied.  Their service was excellent and speedy, although I have yet to visit when they are busy.  Their foccacia with the bruschetta tomatoes is super good.  I could make a meal off of that.  Their pizza is alright.  I think that it is a bit over priced for decent pizza, but it sure isn't anything to go crazy about.  It's good, not spectacular.  I think that they really shine with their appetizers.  I have had the dumplings before, and those were also amazing.

California Pizza Kitchen is California Pizza Kitchen. It's always the same and is almost like a comfort food restaurant. There is usually nothing to complain about except that I need a refill on my strawberry lemonade.  I've been to this CPK a few times with no mishap but this past November I went with a couple friends and received the WORST service ever. We were seated by the host and had to wait 15 minutes before someone took our drink orders. And the MANAGER had to take our orders. The waitress apparently "didn't realize our table was hers". Our drinks were brought out and it was another 10 minutes before we received bread. Another 10 minutes before our orders were taken. The food was fine. About 15 minutes into our meal, I wanted some marinara sauce. 5 minutes attempting to flag down our waitress (Stephanie, I think) resulted in another waiter taking pity and getting the sauce. When we were finally ready for the check, we see our waitress, back to the room, flirting with the pizza maker. It took 10 minutes of annoyed waving and gesturing to get the pizza guy to indicate to her that we needed her assistance.  I think she's gone now so don't be afraid to enjoy CPK's dependable menu with good service.  Food-wise: Garlic Chicken Pizza, Fettucine Alfredo, Chicken with Capers, Avocado Egg Rolls, Hummus, and Chicken Tequila Fettucine are all excellent.

I've only been here for large parties with 10+ people so we've always been sat on the patio. The waiters that we've had have been pretty inattentive and have taken way too long to take our orders, and/or have completely forgotten about them, and kept our drinks empty . I have not eaten the pizza here because I'm not really a pizza person but I do love their chicken tequila pasta. It's the only thing I've gotten and it's tastes great!

I liked the set up of the place. Good lighting, cool roof to look at, seats are comfortable, service is good, food is always pretty good, their pita bread is served fresh, worth going to. And they let me add some shredded lettuce and cooked tomatoes onto the Hawaiian pizza with no charge.
I love this place. All the pizzas are good. Good pastas too. Quick, efficient good service. This location in particular is the best CPK I've tried.

One of my favorite thin crust pizza places. Everyone seems happy at this place. Kind of like going to Disneyland. Pasta usually don't order here because not as special here. Probably minus a half star for the rising prices. $20 for lunch.

CPK offers wide variety gourmet pizzas at reasonable price(runs about 13~15 dollars a person with a soft drink + tax + gratuity). I eat here with my buddies for casual dining. The interior is very inviting and relaxing. I would have to say this CPK franchise is nothing exceptional compared to others. all CPK restaurants provide decent service and quality meals. This place can get pretty packed after 5 on weekends, but the same could be said about other family restaurants in Irvine. Servers are usually friendly most of the time but waiting could be long sometimes. Some of my favorite dishes here are BLT pizza, Sicilian(basil, capicola, etc..) and Fettucine Alfredo.  Overall, I would recommend this place to anyone who's hungry that is looking to have semi-fine casual dining that doesn't hurt your wallet. PRO: Semi-formal feeling dining at a reasonable price.   CON: Slow service sometimes, long waiting time w/o reservation

CPK is always good for a spur of the moment Pizza decision.  I like CPK, however do not come here that often.  I think the restaurant is very clean and the service is good.  Had dinner here the other night, but normally enjoy CPK as more of a lunch spot.  I like the Wild Mushroom Pizza, it is covered in mushrooms which to me makes anything good.  I also enjoy their ceasar or house salad on the side.  However if you want to get a little adventurous, then go with the BBQ Chicken Salad, it is a good size for two people to share, and you can share a small pizza as well.  Before your food comes, they serve free bread and butter, which I find addicting and always get extra. One more thing I noticed this past time I went, they have their Nutrition Menu.  I think this is great so you know how many calories your taking-in to make you feel even guiltier for eating this pizza haha.  But in all seriousness, I think that's good that they have a menu with their nutrition facts.

Went once, and not going back: The pizza at this establishment is average at best! It is very thin, has no content and the toppings have no flavor at all. The price is simply outrageous! For the same price of a personal pizza, you can get a large pizza at Round Table which can feed an entire family. Also serving wine and alcohol is cute and all, but come on! If i want wine, I would go to a REAL italian restaurant.

Since this is a chain, the food is probably going to be the same as all the others, but what sets this apart from the rest is the patio area.  The other Irvine location off of Jamboree is very small and narrow without the luxury of outdoor seating.  This location is much better.

ok , i took into consideration that this place is a chain restaurant and not really a place for people who love to eat so i gave it two stars, i mean i expected to have average pizza that was too expensive, i only came here because i had a gift card, i would rather eat at first class pizza or zito's. but again the corporate crowd love places like this and i have no idea why!!!

first heard about this on fox's good day la and they were raving about the pizza so decided to try it one night with friends.  if you love pizza, you should try cpk cause their pizza is totally different from pizza hut or dominos and its fresh and they have creativity when it comes to their pizzas (toppings).  highly recommend the italian tomato and basil pizza, the works pizza, vegetarian with japanese eggplant pizza.  also try the pan sauteed salmon (i love salmon and halibut those are my "meat"), blue crab cakes, chicken tequila fettuccine, cpk cobb salad and not to mention their yummy desserts :)~ my friend loves the tiramisu and i love the drinks hahaha.  they have my fave. martinis and cosmo, mai tai, pina colada, etc. too many to mention.  they even have microwaveable cpk pizza at your local albertsons or vons but go to cpk in person cause its fresher...microwave foods arent that great and it just isnt the same.
